bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 131 (Tuesday, July 27, 2021)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. JOYCE of Pennsylvania:H.R. 4711.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 3[Page H4090]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy and Mineral Resources.

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Trade.

Referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Rules, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Rules, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

summary.text:
International Pharmaceutical Supply Chain Security Agreement Act of 2021

This bill establishes principal trade negotiating objectives of the United States with respect to pharmaceutical products, including objectives regarding subsidies and government procurement. It also extends through July 1, 2023 (or July 1, 2026, if the President receives an extension) the authority of the President to enter into trade agreements with foreign countries.

bill.title: International Pharmaceutical Supply Chain Security Agreement Act of 2021

item.title: To amend the Bipartisan Congressional Trade Priorities and Accountability Act of 2015 to include principal negotiating objectives of the United States relating to trade in pharmaceutical products, and for other purposes.
International Pharmaceutical Supply Chain Security Agreement Act of 2021
International Pharmaceutical Supply Chain Security Agreement Act of 2021

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Trade.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
